ygData.subject: Re: (no subject)
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been impressed with this site: http://eqss.stratics.com/gamersforum/ You have to register to post, which seems to discourage flamers.  The threads are
ygData.messageBody:
I have been impressed with this site:

http://eqss.stratics.com/gamersforum/

You have to register to post, which seems to discourage flamers. The
threads are also persistant, so you get less repeats. This is my favorite
site for indepth discussions, and has separate forums for just about every
topic, from solo strategies to in game dating. I definately recommend it.

In all fairness, the discussions are not usually as specific as a single
spell, but I would like to see how the group responds to some of your
thoughts. Just don't yell about "broken classes", as you will likely get
nowhere. Start from a solutions point of view, and I think you would be an
asset to the site.

Calyn Dawnwatcher

>Thanks Cristie and others for the nice words, but I think I know the
>problem. This is my first (and probably last) mailing list and I didn't
>realize that they are only for one-shot answers to questions. Does anyone
>know of a good forum (or whatever they are online) where I could go to for
>Everquest spell complaints/suggestions? Besides having beta tested for UO,
>playing Everquest and various info searches, I dont really spend any
>"social" time online and didnt realize that I was breaking Netiquette rules
>here.
>
>Thanks
